reviews.text:
Overall Maison Pickle was good. Solid, tasty food and good bang for your buck but nothing extraordinary. French toast was a bit dry and one of the pieces of fried chicken was super chewy.
The omelet was tasty! And the pull apart pumpkin bread was yummy!
Food is incredible and service was great even with a large party
Everything was excellent, from the pull apart skillet baked bread, crab cakes, hanger steaks and mac and cheese.  Fast and attentive service and a nice atmosphere
Tried to walk in at 7:30pm solo but had no luck. Ordered a slice of cake at the bar to take home. 10/10 chocolate cake. Will be back for dinner soon.
Great food and excellent service

Sorry Maison Pickle but your French Dip was pretty poor. Tough, chewy, stringy and bad tasting. I suppose I am spoiled after eating French Dip at Houston's / Hillstone. Their French Dip is the gold standard and Maison Pickle just doesn't cut the mustard... There was however mustard on the plate which was never mentioned. I should have know it wasn't going to be good when I asked if the meat could be sliced extra thin, I was told it is already sliced... So it's sliced and sitting around for who know how long... The 24 layer cake tasted stale. I so wanted to love my meal.

I ordered takeout the buttermilk caesar salad.The chicken tastes like it's three d printed will never order that again.I don't even think I'll go here.Participate in purchasing anything from this place.Also, they gave me a big giant bowl of salad and no salad dressing.I wish I could give them zero stars.I should have just went to jacob pickles like my first thought
Best brunch I've ever had!!

This place could be so good if they just tried a little harder, because the concept is great.

There's no need for the food to be as absurdly greasy as it is. The roux on my deluxe French dip was floury and gross. The sandwich would be SO much better if it had caramelized onions and cheese inside, instead of a haphazard topping of roux and batter-fried onions (like, how am I supposed to dip it if half the ingredients are outside the sandwich??).

There's also kind of a weird smell in the restaurant that turned my stomach, I am sensitive to these things but it smells a bit like a dirty rag and burnt grease :(

So we came here hunting for chocolate layer cake but they were out. Probably for the best as we had stuffed our faces with the amazing garlic and parmesan pull apart bread and some deviled eggs. We got French dip sandwiches and the French gruyere frites with bacon. The food was really top notch!

The entire menu is delicious...this is my new favorite place. The Patty melt, the TomHawk Steak, and the 24 layer Chocolate Cake..

My Hungry Man came out to play.

My partner and I dined yesterday for brunch. We didnâ€™t have reservations but were seated immediately. The food was amazing but the service was outstanding. Kailey F was our server and she was warm, knowledgeable, and very patient. All of her recommendations were top notch. Would definitely return again just for her alone.

Terrible !!!!
Terrible food
Terrible prices
I recently did a Collab with them for Instagram @jenonthescene and they have the best espresso, martini flight and pull apart bread, especially the garlic and Parmesan one.
excellent cocktails and dessert!
Food and service was top notch!

Came here for an anniversary today and although it was busy, the service was excellent! Jacqueline took great care of us. The food came out quickly and was pretty good with huge portion sizes that will definitely last me and my partner at least another day. Their 24 layer chocolate cake was also excellent, not too sweet, and we were able to take the leftovers to go. The cake was on the house for our occasion and even came with a cute sparkler. It was a little loud, but the warm service and great food made up for it!
Fist visit was okay. Second time disappointed.
The front bartender is on point. The drinks are good. The food is okay.

Come for the viral, 24-layer cake and stay for the spectacular food and incredible service! We came here to celebrate my mom's birthday and the staff and management went above and beyond to take care of us. They also supported our daughter, who is a picky eater, by putting together a meal for her that was not on the menu, and all the food we got (including the insane cake) was absolutely delicious!

My devotion to this place is complete. Pleasant surroundings, helpful servers, and quality meals. They ensure you leave satisfied. The employees demonstrated exceptional service consistency. Entirely enjoyable!
Entire experience was great. Food was outstanding and the cake didnâ€™t disappoint. The drinks were also well crafted.
Delicious

Oh man this place has the best bread with honey butter I have ever had. The beer was $9 and was so so cold. I only had room for the bread and beer but the menu looked amazing. I definitely recommend making reservations. They only seat you if your whole party is there. I was able to wait at the bar. Our reservation was for 5:30. By 6pm it was packed. So if you have friends who are notoriously late, give them a fake time!

Funny place. Went with French guests. French toast and French dip donâ€™t really exist in France. Had French dip deluxe. Very tasty no matter what it is called.
Went back recently and want to praise the mussels.  Also, had the 24 layer chocolate cake.  not too sweet.  pretty much perfect. And to-go boxes specially designed make it easy to eat the next day or two.
This place is absolutely amazing. The pull apart bread literally melts in your mouth. The mac and cheese had the best cheese pull. I will be back!
Best steak and eggs iâ€™ve ever had. French toast slaps

Sometimes annoying things happen at restaurants â€“ â€“ like when you have a reservation for 6:30 and they havenâ€™t seated you after 7. The real issue is what the restaurant does to ameliorate the situation. We had just this happen tonight at Mason Pickle. Instead of simply seating us and ignoring the wait, Bar Director, Jorge Paz, and his staff, including the Manager of Mason Pickle,treated us like royalty. Their apology was in the form of lovely appetizers and fabulous desserts. And then there was our meal itself. Every morsel visibly inviting and fabulously delicious. Our party of eight nearly licked their plates clean. Put Maison Pickle on your go to list; you will not be disappointed. To the folks at Maison Pickleâ€¦ thank you, thank you, thank you, for a lovely evening.  Weâ€™ll be back!
My husband and I canâ€™t wait to go back to try the pull apart bread and mac and cheese!! We didnâ€™t want to overload ourselves at our first visit. Looking forward to the next!
Be warned of the huge portion sizes. I would recommend sharing plates if itâ€™s just two people otherwise you wonâ€™t have room for dessert. Great service & yummy drinks

The portions are huge. That may or may not be a good thing. The acoustics arent great, its kinda noisy but the sergicd was relativeky speedy. Menu has a wide variety, when back in the city I'd probably go again to try something else on the menu.

Sunday was my 3rd time coming to this restaurant and the food is always good and the overall customer service is normally good. I recommend the pull apart bread (Iâ€™ve tried the honey butter one only) and the Dâ€™olived eggs. Iâ€™ve tried one of their french dip sandwiches and their patty melt as well, and theyâ€™re both good but I donâ€™t feel it always tastes consistently good every time I go.

Iâ€™ve come here multiple times and can confidently say the food does not disappoint. Easily one of my favorite restaurants in the area, plus the portion sizes are huge! I can typically turn one entrÃ©e into 2-3 total meals, especially if I share a starter first. Sleeper hit: the dâ€™olived eggs.

What  a great  brunch place! The  food was  great, fresh and tasty! The  French toast was sinful!
The  place was  packed at 1:30 on a Saturday  (so it was  a bit noisey) but died down a bit around 3:30pm.
The  wait  wasn't long  and The  food came out quick. I had  an feta and spinach omelette and my  friend had the patty melt and next to me someone had French toast which  looked like it had the works on it!
Portions were large! Service was  fantastic! I'll  be back.

Meh. So disappointed as I had a decent meal here before and have always enjoyed Jacobâ€™s Pickle. Service was tops though and I enjoyed my Smoke& F ire cocktail  but ugh, that French Dip, not sure how that sneaked past the kitchen staff. I made the bigger mistake of ordering the deluxe. Way too much going on there. Cannot taste anything except this cheese sauce which I wish I could say was better. The beef has no seasoning whatsoever. At least not that I can discern. Bread is way too soft. Basically just blah - one texture, no real taste. Deviled eggs were decent, have certainly had much better and the pull
apart bread is gimmicky - with too much butter to be practical. Just shock value. Really pains me to leave such a harsh review but at these prices and with so many options, I have little choice.

We were in town attending the Ryder Cup and was recommended Maison Pickle by someone. We were able to grab a reservation easily for that same night. Once we got there the place was so cute. We ended up sitting in a small upstairs balcony area over looking the main restaurant. Our waitress was great, food was great and vibes were even better! They had a great music playlist going Sunday night and we sang about every song. 3 of us had the steak frites and another had a French dip. All delicious and the garlic pull apart bread was a great starter! Finished our meal off with the 24 layer chocolate cake! Canâ€™t recommend this restaurant enough and we were so happy to find it ourselves! We will definitely be back on our next trip to NYC.
Enormous portions and very friendly staff. Highly recommend.
Everything was great, except we were expecting more pickles

The food is good, though a little overpriced. But my god never order online. They will take minimally 90mins if not two hours. No matter what. You can call and they'll act like it's a sudden thing that they're late. Just awful delivery service. Don't bother.

Wait staff were patient, happy and attentive but the FOH lady told us bluntly that we'd have to start ordering appetisers and drinks as soon as we sat down whilst we waited for our guest (there was no queue and no shortage of tables).

Atmosphere and decor was sleek and elegant but unfortunately did not make up for average food and the attitude of the FOH staff.

For the love of God, I've never tasted anything so delicious. A friend invited me to a machesse through Uber Eats. Holy crap, it's the most delicious thing I've ever eaten. I'll try to go to the restaurant someday. Thank you so much.
ã‚¢ãƒ¡ãƒªã‚«ãƒ³ãƒ€ã‚¤ãƒŠãƒ¼ãªãŠåº—ã€‚é‡ãŒã¨ã¦ã‚‚å¤šãã€ä¸€äººã‹äºŒäººåˆ©ç”¨ã¯å°‘ã—è¾›ã„ã€‚å‘³ã‚‚å¤§å‘³ã§æ¿ƒã„ã€‚ã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¤ã‚¿ãƒ¼ã®æ°—é£ã„ã¨åº—ã®é›°å›²æ°—ã¯å‡„ãè‰¯ã„ã®ã§ã€é›†å›£ã§ã®åˆ©ç”¨ã«ã¯ãŠå‹§ã‚ã€‚

Honestly was kind of a bummer. The chicken ceasar was a literal PLATTER of salad, but the dressing was under seasoned and the lettuce was SWIMMING in it. The rolls we had as a started were amazing! Would stick with the more carb heavy goods than the salad. And for the price ğŸ’€
The food was so good, and our service was great!
Tried Maison P for the first time with my lady friends and it ğŸ‘ğŸ»wasğŸ‘ğŸ»perfectğŸ‘ğŸ»! Great food, wild ( and by wild, meaning abundant ) portions, cute ambiance, great service. Would come back!
The staff was friendly, the portions were huge, and the drinks were delicious.

I was told over the phone that there was plenty of seating and no wait for a party of 2. When we came in, they insisted that we could only sit on the side by side mezzanine seating upstairs due to a performer coming in at 12. They stated that all of the tables in the main area were taken up due to this. We reluctantly agreed and took those seats. However, during the entire duration of our stay, there were at least 8-10 unoccupied tables in the main area. We left around 12:40 and the performer never came on. In addition, the tables in the upper area became available. When we asked the hostess if we could move she rudely said â€œno, thereâ€™s a large party I have to seat. Youâ€™re going to have to stay where you are.â€ It was extremely infantilizing. In addition, there were two seats remaining  that she seated a different couple at about 15 minutes later.

Our server was quite nice. However, we asked for our steak with fries and she said she would check with the chef. That did not happen, it came with breakfast potatoes instead. The steaks was medium rare instead of medium well as asked. The challah French toast was incredibly dry and cold. We did not get any condiments including salt, pepper, ketchup or syrup. We had to ask for these.

Clearly we were very frustrated and asked for the manager. The manager Tiffany arrived after 10 minutes and all she could offer was to â€œre-educate her staff.â€

Overall, terrible experience. Will never come back.

So yesterday was my 1st experience patronizing this restaurant. A1 service by Waitress Carlee if you go ask for her! My best friend and I went for Happy Hour at 5 pm. Not too busy and comfortable as far as temperature. The waitress introduced herself and gave recommendations when asked. Carlee was just pleasuable and attentive to us and the rest of her tables in her section. The Artichoke appetizer was DELICIOUS as well as the PULL apart Bread (Garlic and Parm topping)! For my main I have the Ruben French Dip and man O MAN mouth watering and can't forget the pickles. The meal was tasty from start to finish. Thank Carlee for the experience!

Excellent customer service. The Mac n cheese was the best. The Hawaiian rolls were good, the steak n eggs were so so, I had the chocolate cake. It was good, it's not sweet sweet. It's huge. Took me 3 days to eat the cake. The tables are kinda small and uneven/wobbly, they had food gnats flying around our food, it was kinda irritating. I know they can't control that. But overall I would go there again and try other food plus more mac n cheese.
Not kidding, this may be the best restaurant in NYC. My omelette was incredibly perfect and the French toast towers are insane! Great service and incredible food. Looking forward to a return visit

I went to Mason Pickle on the Upper West Side with a friend, and we thought weâ€™d try a little bit of everythingâ€”which, in hindsight, may have been a mistake! Their portion sizes are insane. Honestly, just one mac & cheese couldâ€™ve easily fed two people.

We ended up ordering the pull-apart bread, egg & cheese sandwich, mac & cheese, and French toastâ€¦ and could barely get through a few bites of each. Everything was rich, buttery, and very delicious. Not exactly light, but definitely satisfying.

The only thing I wouldnâ€™t recommend is the egg & cheese sandwich. It was way too greasy for my taste.

Just a heads-up: if youâ€™re hoping for a quiet brunch and easy conversation, it gets really loud. But if youâ€™re in it for the food, youâ€™ll leave happy.

With all the restaurants in NYC, I rarely go back to a restaurant twice but I will be making an exception for Maison Pickle. Iâ€™m truly going to dream about this establishment until I have the opportunity to come back.

Every single thing we tried was mouthwatering and delicious. Because of the large portion sizes, you can totally share with another person if you prefer, and in fact I did so with plenty left over.

In terms of space, the restaurant was nicely decorated and vibes immaculate. Everywhere you looked, people seemed to be enjoying themselves and the food. I cant wait to come back.

Food: pull apart bread and butter 1000/10 - it literally melts in your mouth and is so good. I would come back just to get this alone; hot honey chicken and toast 8/10, I loved the flavoring of the chicken. Not too spicy; chocolate cake - 10/10. You canâ€™t go wrong with any of the cakes they offer. Portions are huge

Atmosphere: 10/10. The space was huge, and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.

Service: 10/10 very attentive staff

This place is a fantastic restaurant! ğŸ´ Maison ğŸ  Pickle ğŸ¥’ offers a wonderful selection of delicious ğŸ¤¤ dishes ğŸ½ï¸ - definitely get the Caesar salad ğŸ¥— with fried chicken ğŸ”, Hot ğŸ”¥ Honey ğŸ¯ Chicken ğŸ“ Sandwich ğŸ¥ª, and Fries ğŸŸ with Gruyere Cheese ğŸ§€  and Bacon. ğŸ¥“ Their claim to fame is the French ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Dip Sandwiches and there crown ğŸ‘‘ jewel ğŸ’ is actually the Pull Apart Bread ğŸ with Garlic ğŸ§„ and Herbs ğŸŒ¿!- definitely worth trying! The staff ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ³ is super friendly, welcoming, and professional (thanks Brianna!), the place is beautifully decorated ğŸ›‹ï¸, has lots of indoor seating ğŸª‘ and some outdoor seating, the ambiance ğŸ¶ is great, and the service is quick. â²ï¸ I wish I came here more often!

Many of my friends recommend this place so I decided to check it out and made a reservation for my friends birthday. We ordered a bottle of champagne, french toast, steak and eggs and the pull apart bread. Everything was delicious, definitely on the pricier side but overall great service and food. I wish they had offered something for my friendâ€™s birthday since we had a $300 check at the end but nothing. Itâ€™s not expected but itâ€™s always a nice gesture when places offer a free drink or dessert.
Steak was cooked as I ordered and was so filling and delicious. Definitely a favorite. Excited to come back.

I had a great experience at Maison Pickle! The food was deliciousâ€”comforting, flavorful, and generously portioned. The service was equally impressive. Our server was warm, attentive, and genuinely thoughtful. One small gesture that stood out: it was raining when we were leaving, and without us asking, they gave us extra bags for our leftovers just in case the rain tore through the original one. That level of care really makes a difference.

Definitely looking forward to coming back!
éå¸¸æ£’çš„ç¾é£Ÿé¤å…ï¼Œæ°›å›´æ„Ÿå¾ˆå¥½ï¼Œé‡éå¸¸å¤§ï¼Œæ¯æ¬¡æ¥éƒ½åƒæ’‘ã€‚ èœ‚èœœç‚¸é¸¡åå¸æœ‰ç‚¹è…»å»ºè®®å’Œåˆ«äººåˆ†äº«ï¼Œç‰›æ’éå¸¸ç¾å‘³ã€è’œé¦™é¢åŒ…å¾ˆæ¾è½¯ï¼Œæ²™æ‹‰è§£è…»å¿…ç‚¹

Cool place with good food. I got the Berries-n-Cream French Toast. The pictures don't do it justice! The bread was about 1.5 inches thick!! Far too much food, but it was fun to eat. My husband went with the Deluxe French Dip with fries and enjoyed it. The salty fries I stole from him were very tasty with my sweet meal. We ate at 11:15am on a Mon and nearly had the place to ourselves.

Overhyped food & god awful service - This is how I would summarize my experience at Maison Pickle. Our server, Carly, was the absolute worst. After greeting us and pouring some water she was never to be seen again. It wasnâ€™t until 20 minutes later we had to finally flag down a server who was on his way out for the night to take our full drink&food order because we couldnâ€™t get Carlyâ€™s attention. Once our food arrived we were extremely unimpressedâ€¦ everything other than the pull apart bread tasted average & honestly comparable to the Cheesecake Factory. We were hoping to end the night on a high with their famous layered chocolate cake, but once the busser cleared our food, Carly dropped the check and walked awayâ€¦. No additional drink order, didnâ€™t ask if we wanted dessert, nothing. It then took us another 10 minutes to flag her down and tell her we wanted the cake & by then she said â€œthe kitchen said we could only take it to goâ€ as by this time they were closing up. Honestly the most laughable experience with non impressive food. Donâ€™t waste your limited time in NYC by coming here.

PS we got the cake to-go, and it also sucked. My group all took one bite and then threw it away.

I will become a regular! Food is made well, portions are HUGE, price is fair & affordable, spacious, good service. 18% gratuity built in. James our server was awesome too :)

We got steak & eggs which came with fries, medium rare was yum - good crust with red inside! Pull apart bread is fire, we got honey butter. The weekend special tiramisu french toast was ginormous, not overly sweet, really good.

Service was fast, attentive, and friendly.

Make a reservation because it gets busy fast!!

Maison pickle failed to meet the hype for my party. We tried a few things, the best being their sandwiches (the patty melt specifically) and pull apart bread. Their mac and cheese was also very cheesy but left much to be desired. The steak was over cooked, and the cake was dry/stale. The drinks were great and very strong. As for atmosphere, the biggest problem is the tables are much too close to each other and the spaces can be cramped. The moody lighting and decor was great otherwise. Our server was also prompt and kind.
Visually the food is amazing... But really lacked flavor.  The portions are big and the service was great.  Most of all, it was not nearly as expensive as I thought.

If you stick to their signature dishes - French Dip, chicken and waffles, etc., you'll do well and enjoy. Don't go for the fancy menu fillers here. My dining companion ordered steak cooked medium-well, well, it was way dry and burnt. Thankfully, the waitstaff agreed that it was overcooked and got another - though we question their quality control. The place is much bigger than it looks from the street...

I came to Maison Pickle for their $45 Restaurant Week dinner and had such a great experience. Everything I ordered was delicious and satisfying from start to finish. The watermelon salad was super refreshing, loved the mix of red and yellow watermelon with cherry tomatoes, feta, and a tangy lime vinaigrette. The crab artichoke and spinach dip was so creamy and flavorful, and the toasted bread it came with was the perfect pairing.

For the entrÃ©es, I had both the steak frites and the chicken & eggplant parm. The ribeye steak was cooked just right and full of flavor, and the fries were super crispy. The parm was rich, cheesy, and comforting, definitely something Iâ€™d order again.

Desserts were such a highlight too. The Oreo icebox pie was nostalgic and creamy, and the 24-layer chocolate cake was just iconic, decadent but not overly sweet. Overall, the food was amazing, the portions were generous, and the service and ambiance made the experience even better. Iâ€™m already looking forward to coming back!

Went here on a Sunday morning and it was packed. Great vibes and awesome staff. Food is a little pricey but huge portions and tasted pretty great. Recommend the french dip sandwiches.

Might also see some celebrities here.

We were expecting so much.  Thought maybe with a French word in the name portions might be more euro and less Texas.  Steak ordered mid-rare came out uneven but mostly medium well.  We did not even order bread which is like an enormous loaf with some very large topping. Seemed like butter.  So enormous super size me portions.  I got suckered in by the name patty melt.  And the server highly recommended it.  Except that it wasn't a patty melt and the description on the menu was not a description of what you get.  E.g. two patties.  And my bad it does say buttermilk bread.  I object to other than rye bread.  There is a Reuben on the menu so maybe they could make the patty melt to order... grilled rye caramelized onions patty with melted Swiss cheese.  This is just a great classic I was disappointed in the monsterous size and mediocre interpretation.  This is a place to go if you like making 3 meals out of one. And my daughter did have a small fly on her plate... So we actually did not take her leftovers home

We had mixed feelings after dinner here. On one hand, the prices are very low compared to the average restaurants on the UWS. On the other hand, the service felt like â€œjust tell me what you want.â€ We received our drinks about 10 minutes after ordering, and my steak was only slightly warm. I expected it to come straight off the grill.

Loved this spot for brunch!
Went on a packed Saturday morning â€” definitely make a reservation. The GruyÃ¨re fondue fries, mac & cheese, and garlic pull-apart bread were all amazing (and huge portions!). Ordered bloody mary & El Segundo wallet for drinks. But the 24-layer chocolate cake? Absolutely unreal. Best chocolate cake ever.

Came here twice and agreed that this place is consistently a great place for a group luncheon. The portions are generous and super reasonably priced. Took a star off because I think they could make the food even tastier than it already is today. Will come again.

I came here for brunch and was impressed by both the food and service. The chicken and French toast were absolutely delicious, with the perfect balance of crispy and sweet, however it was a large plate and messy to eat. The mac and cheese was rich, cheesy, and full of flavor. The pull apart bread was fresh and sooo good! My friends also enjoyed their meals but agreed to large to finish. Portions are massive, so come hungry or be ready to take leftovers home. The service was attentive, with staff making sure we had everything we needed. The restaurant stays busy, so I highly recommend booking a reservation in advance.

This is the best French Dip sandwich I've ever had.

I've been here twice now but will always make the trip out because it is SO good. The vibe is great, the service is great but the Deluxe French Dip is next level.

They will also recommend the pull apart bread and there is a reason. It. Is. Scrumptious. Cocktails are also delightful. I have yet to try the chocolate cake but one day, it will be mine.

Can't recommend enough!

We attended for restaurant week after wanting to try this spot for a while. We enjoyed our tasty cocktails but the food was bland and didnâ€™t meet our expectations. Service was great, just expected more for the price point.

We had the honey butter break apart bread, steak frites, filet mignon, and lemonade. The lemonade was perfectly balanced and refreshing. The steak had good flavor but was slightly dry, and the fries were a bit bland. The bread was soft, buttery, and the highlight of the meal.

On a quick girlsâ€™ trip from Miami to New York, we had one mission before catching a Broadway show: find a solid brunch spot that wouldnâ€™t feel like yet another tourist trap. A local swore by Maison Pickle on the Upper West Side, so I trusted the tip, hopped on Resy, and locked in a table.

We rolled in straight from the airport (shoutout to NYCâ€™s public transit for the unintentional city tour), and even though we were running on travel fumes, we were seated right away. The staff was friendly, fast, and ready for our big brunch expectations.

We werenâ€™t super hungry, so we kept it light: a couple of drinks and one dish to share. I ordered The Razzle, a gin-based cocktail with raspberry and lemon. It sounded fun, but it was a little too tart for my tasteâ€”one of those drinks that starts cute but overstays its welcome.

Then came the real star: the Croque Madame with fried chicken. When we ordered it, we thought weâ€™d get a fried chicken side situation. Nope. The fried chicken was in the sandwich. Surprise! And what a happy accident that was.

Crispy chicken? Check. Toasted bread? Check. Perfectly runny egg on top? You bet. Every bite was savory, crunchy, and indulgent in the best way. We definitely werenâ€™t prepared for how good it was, but we rallied like champs.

And let me just say: everything coming out of that kitchen looked ridiculousâ€”in the best way. French toast towers, massive sandwiches, comfort food galore. If weâ€™d shown up with a real appetite we wouldâ€™ve gone to town.

Final take: Maison Pickle is now firmly on my NYC rotation. Great service, bold flavors, and a far cry from the overpriced, underwhelming spots that somehow stay packed in Midtown. If you're looking for brunch that delivers without the tourist tax, this is your place.

We had such a wonderful evening at this restaurant. I enjoyed a perfectly cooked branzino while my husband and my in-laws shared laughs over a juicy burger delicious fries and to top it off We had a gorgeous slice of cake. We sipped on a bottle of wine, talked, and just soaked in the cozy atmosphere. Itâ€™s one of those places that has something for everyoneâ¤ï¸but more than that, it gave us a night weâ€™ll remember.ğŸ˜˜

THIS IS MY FAVORITE PLACE!!! I asked my girlfriend to prom here. (She said yes!) Everyone was so helpful and supportive. Nowâ€¦.. I ALWAYS COME BACK FOR THE BUFFALO MAC AND CHEESE AND OFC THE 24 LAYERED CHOCOLATE CAKE (Itâ€™s the best especially when room temperature)

Came here for restaurant week with some coworkers and honestly it fell flat of my expectations. The drinks were fine and the appetizers were good but the main meal was not it. I got the sirloin beef which was like a sandwhich with a side of french onion soup to dip it in. I honestly wasnt a fan of it and my coworkers didnt care for their meals either. Got the 24 layer cake and aside from being pretty it lacked flavorâ€¦ overall I just didnâ€™t care for this restaurant. Only thing I absolutely loved was the watermelon salad. I will dream about that salad foreverâ€¦

Maison Pickle is one of those places you just keep coming back to. The food is comforting, and seriously deliciousâ€”the French dip sandwiches are a must, and everything from the challah bread French toast to the cocktails are delicious.

The space has a great vibeâ€”bustling but never too chaoticâ€”and the staff is consistently kind and helpful. Whether itâ€™s brunch with friends or a cozy dinner date, Maison Pickle always hits the mark. A real Upper West Side favorite.
